eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500
java.version=1.6.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=zh_CN
Framework arguments:  -showsplashorg.eclipse.platform --launcher.XXMaxPermSize384M
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -showsplashorg.eclipse.platform --launcher.XXMaxPermSize384M

You need to run with a bigger permgen space, then :-)

http://wiki.eclipse.org/FAQ_How_do_I_increase_the_permgen_size_available_to_Eclipse%3F

Your -showsplash doesn't have a space after it, so I wonder if that's throwing the launcher, and you're not seeing the --launcher afterwards. 

What does your eclipse.ini look like?

Alex.

(In reply to comment #2)

> 
> What does your eclipse.ini look like?
> 
> Alex.
> 

Below is my eclipse.ini
-showsplashorg.eclipse.platform
--launcher.XXMaxPermSize512M
-vmargs
-Xms256m
-Xmx512m

Thanks 
andrew.du

The lines
-showsplashorg.eclipse.platform
and 
--launcher.XXMaxPermSize
is the problem. You appear to have accidentally deleted a newline. It should be:
-showsplash
org.eclipse.platform
--launcher.XXMaxPermSize
128M
-vmargs
-Xms40m
-Xmx512m

Alex.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 92250 ***
